intro: Stipa syreistschikowii, commonly known as the Siberian needlegrass, is a perennial grass species native to the cold climates of Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny flowers, typical of the Poaceae family. It is adapted to grow in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in steppe and alpine environments. Stipa syreistschikowii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms in its native range.
